intro: Acer polycarpon, commonly known as the European maple, is a deciduous tree native to Europe and western Asia. It typically grows to a height of 10–20 meters, featuring a broad, rounded crown and smooth, gray bark. The leaves are palmately lobed, with five to seven pointed lobes, and turn vibrant yellow in the fall. Its small, red samaras are produced in clusters and disperse via wind. The plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland habitats.
